results.firPara: When Zlatan Ibrahimovic wanted a new agent he asked a friend, the Dutch journalist Thijs Slegers, for a couple of suggestions. The first one to come back was the firm that represented David Beckham. Theyre supposed to be terrific, Slegers said. And then, theres another guy but, well …
results.webTitle: Mino Raiola: a fearless negotiator who got his revenge with Paul Pogba deal

results.firPara: Crystal Palace have resumed negotiations with Liverpool over the transfer of Christian Benteke, with the Belgium striker close to completing his move to Selhurst Park for a club record fee.
results.secPara: Palace, who rejected an £18m bid from Everton for the forward Yannick Bolasie this week, have been in the market for a target man all summer after signing Andros Townsend from Newcastle in June.
results.webTitle: Liverpool’s Christian Benteke close to Crystal Palace move after talks resume

results.firPara: In todays Fiver club media departments, mascot excuses, and much more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver club media departments, mascot excuses, and much more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Outdone by their own laundry ladies

results.firPara: Walter Mazzarri and Quique Sánchez Flores both have dark hair and come from southern Europe. There the similarities end. At the end of last season Watford cast adrift a diminutive, slender, softly spoken, friendly Spaniard and hired in his stead a stocky, spiky, snarling Italian, a man who both smokes and fumes, is renowned for furious outbursts on the touchline and admits that Ive always been an unpopular coach.
results.secPara: Mazzarri has been out of work, if not money, since being sacked by Internazionale in November 2014, the sole significant blot on his managerial record. The Italians continued to pay his €3.5m a year salary until the end of June, allowing Mazzarri to, among other things, spend the last six months of last season in Manchester, immersing himself in Premier League football, living with an English family and studying the language with Sean Warren, co-author of the book English for Football. Though given his workaholic tendencies Mazzarri surely did not want for effort, his linguistic skills remain very much unproven. In a stilted video message to Watford fans following his appointment, he admitted he will need to start the season with an interpreter by his side.
results.webTitle: Fiery perfectionist Walter Mazzarri can raise Watford to greater heights | Simon Burnton

results.firPara: Guardian writers predicted position 10th (NB this is not necessarily Paul Doyles prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 season preview No14: Stoke City | Paul Doyle

results.firPara: Manchester Uniteds world-record signing has at times been less effective in a 4-2-3-1, as was evident at Euro 2016, but will Mourinho abandon his favoured formation in favour of 4-3-3?
results.secPara: Manchester Uniteds world-record signing has at times been less effective in a 4-2-3-1, as was evident at Euro 2016, but will Mourinho abandon his favoured formation in favour of 4-3-3?
results.webTitle: José Mourinho may struggle to get best from Paul Pogba in a 4-2-3-1 formation | Michael Cox

results.firPara: Manchester City have finally completed the signing of John Stones from Everton, paying an initial £47.5m to make the 22-year-old the second most expensive defender in history after David Luiz.
results.secPara: The conclusion to a transfer saga that has been running all summer was, in effect, leaked by Uefa on Tuesday morning when it published the squad City had submitted for next weeks Champions League qualifying round game against Steaua Bucharest.
results.webTitle: Manchester City complete £47.5m signing of John Stones from Everton

results.firPara: Despite Brazil and Colombias Olympic efforts, meager resources and entrenched attitudes mean the womens game on the continent is a poor relation to the mens
results.secPara: Despite Brazil and Colombias Olympic efforts, meager resources and entrenched attitudes mean the womens game on the continent is a poor relation to the mens
results.webTitle: Rio 2016: South American women's soccer still fighting for respect

results.firPara: The Everton defender John Stones was named by the official Uefa website in the Manchester City Champions League squad for the play-off match with Steaua Bucharest before he was officially announced as their player. Stones was listed as the clubs No24.
results.secPara: We have checked with the club [Manchester City] and the player is in the squad, a Uefa spokeswoman told the Guardian on Tuesday morning. We received all of the squad lists from the clubs before the deadline – so before midnight – and submitted them to our website which is the standard procedure.
results.webTitle: Uefa names John Stones in Manchester City Champions League squad before move announced
